prompt.preamble:
We are testing a system for understanding people's fuzzy intuitions and preferences.
In this experiment, we'll be capturing your moral intuitions about the act of stealing a loaf of bread, and whether there are certain cases where stealing may be morally permissible.
prompt.task_description: your belief of when it is moral to steal a loaf of bread
prompt.final: In the final part of the study, you will give feedback on a test set of moral situations, which will enable us to see how well a chatbot reading your responses has learned your moral preferences.
prompt.evaluation: Please indicate whether you think the following situations are morally permissible or not: "yes" if they are, "no" if they aren't.

conversation_history.message: Situation: Is it ethical to steal a loaf of bread if it's the last one in a store during a severe supply shortage, and you have the money to pay but realize a homeless, starving person is also eyeing the same loaf?
It would not be ethical in this situation. You should not steal the bread in this scenario.
Situation: Is it ethical to steal a loaf of bread if you have enough money to buy your own, but you decide to steal for the thrill or to prove a point about the societal structure and ownership?
This situation is even more unethical than the last scenario. You should not steal the bread.

Situation: Is it ethical to steal a loaf of bread if you have no money, you and your family are hungry, and the shop owner has knowingly overpriced the bread in a disaster situation to exploit vulnerable people?
Yes. In this scenario it would be ethical to steal the bread. You should protect your family and the owner is unethical.

Situation: Is it ethical to steal a loaf of bread, if you are a time-traveler from the future, knowing that the bread you steal today will cause a series of events that will significantly improve the world, but in the present, you have the means to buy your own bread?
If it will improve the world then steal the bread. This would be ethical.

Situation: Is it ethical to steal a loaf of bread if you are an undercover law enforcement officer trying to gain trust in a criminal gang and stealing is a test of your loyalty, but you have the money to buy the bread and the theft would negatively impact a small business owner?
This would be ethical. It is part of your job and would be necessary.

query_prompt.content:
Your task is to learn under what conditions the user would believe it is or is not ethical to steal a loaf of bread.

Come up with a potential edge case to learn as much information as you can about what their desired behavior should be under different circumstances.
Make sure the edge case addresses different aspects of the system than the edge cases that have already been considered.

An example edge case is: Situation: Is it ethical to steal a loaf of bread if you are starving to death and the bread would otherwise go to waste?

Current cases:
- [Q] -> [A]

Generate the most informative edge case that, when answered, will reveal the most about the desired behavior beyond what has already been queried for above. Generate the edge case in the following format, and nothing else: "Situation: [edge case]"
